summary: Avengers: Endgame Concept Art Depicts Thanos with Eternals
title: Avengers: Endgame Concept Art Depicts Thanos with Eternals
body:
Avengers: Endgame Concept Art Depicts Thanos with Eternals

Avengers: Endgame concept art showcases a young Thanos standing next to an Eternals family.

The concept art comes courtesy of Ryan Lang, who posted it on his Instagram. However, he has since deleted the post, but it was quickly captured and shared on Twitter.

According to ComicBook, Lang captioned the photo, “Thanos family portrait (not really). I was asked to visualize what Eternals looked like…

View On WordPress

summary: Directores De Avengers: Endgame Harán Magic: The Gathering Para Netflix #Netflix #shironodesaina #nekodemonio...
title: Directores De Avengers: Endgame Harán Magic: The Gathering Para Netflix #Netflix #shironodesaina #nekodemonio #CorporativoArcanos #Noticias
body:
Anthony y Joe Russo, los directores de Avengers: Infinity War y Avengers: Endgame, harán la serie animada de Magic: The Gathering para Netflix.

Sin duda esta es una de las sorpresas de la semana. A través de NX (@NXOnNetflix), la cuenta en Twitter de Netflixespecializada en anuncios de ciencia ficción, fantasía y anime, la compañía reveló algo impactante. Anthony y Joe Russo, quienes…

summary: Godzilla is King of the Box Office
title: Godzilla is King of the Box Office
body:
Godzilla is King of the Box Office #godzilla #movies

Godzilla: King of the Monsters topped the weekend box office, though came in at the lower end of studio expectations. Rocketman and Ma both beat their studio’s expectations in their debuts.

Godzilla: King of the Monsters debuted with an estimated $49 million. The film had expectations to earn $50-55 million and was short of the $93.2 million opening for the 2014 reboot and Kong: Skull…

summary:
Fury: *to tony* you’re part of a bigger universe you just don’t know it yet
Tony: *sees The Universe past the portal and has...
body:
Iron Man (2008):

Fury: *to tony* you’re part of a bigger universe you just don’t know it yet

Avengers (2012):

Tony: *sees The Universe past the portal and has nightmares of said universe*

Iron Man 3 (2013):

Tony: *has PTSD from A1*

Avengers: AOU (2015):

Tony: *points to space* that’s the end game

Avengers: IW (2018):

Tony: *after finding out about Thanos* this is it

Avengers: Endgame (2019):

Tony: *uses the stones to make Thanos, and his army, dust, ultimately killing the threat that has been hanging over his head for a decade*

Me:

summary: Emo bands in the MCU would have a field day with the Thanos Snap
body: Emo bands in the MCU would have a field day with the Thanos Snap

reblog.comment: Emo bands in the MCU would have a field day with the Thanos Snap

trail.content_raw: Emo bands in the MCU would have a field day with the Thanos Snap
trail.content: Emo bands in the MCU would have a field day with the Thanos Snap

body:
endgame meta uwu

I’ve been trying to understand Steve’s reasons for going back to the past and wanting a different life, a do over.

And then it hit me…what if the instigating event that convinces Steve to go back and try and live a different life, to make a difference in a timeline where things haven’t yet gone to shit…is his and Tony’s encounter with Howard Stark of the past.

What if watching Tony interact with his dead father, Steve is hit by all the what-ifs and what-could-have-beens if only things hadn’t gone so badly wrong in Steve and Tony’s own timeline. If only the people Steve cared about had got a shot at happiness with each other.

What if…the reason Steve chose to go back in time again and create a new timeline wasn’t only for Peggy but because he realised how easy it was to fix so many mistakes and prevent so much grief and suffering by simple actions. What if he also went back to convince Howard to get a vasectomy?

tags: your smile is more precious than the nine realms
summary: You know what would have been so cool to see? Carol and Loki working together to find Tony. Loki using his astral projections...
body: You know what would have been so cool to see? Carol and Loki working together to find Tony. Loki using his astral projections and his magic to check galaxies where he and Nebula would be and then when the location is verified and confirmed, Carol goes to get Tony and Nebula. Meanwhile, Loki is just faced with awkward silence with the other Avengers. Except for Pepper who is just sobbing after finding out Tony’s alive and can come home.

title: The new ending
body:
Hello, So for my film appreciation class we were allowed to rewrite an ending to a movie so I picked endgame but heads up this is straight from the paper so wording might be off

I would change the ending by showing Steve Rogers going to drop off the final piece of the device in the 70s were his former lover Peggy Carter was and showing him take a moment to look in her office as her husband and kids walk in on him. The scene would show Steve and Peggy’s husband having a brief conversation and Steve would say something along the lines of “I’m a custodian and I should go clean out the other rooms” as he would exit the room.

The viewers would see how sad and defeated he would be until he bumps into his old flame. He shields his face from her and deepens his voice, but Peggy recognizes him in an instance.

“Steve?” She would say alarmed and confused as he draggers her to an empty coat closet. Peggy would turn on the light illuminating the dark closet and then touch Steve face as tears well in both her eyes and his eyes.

“I thought…you were dead?” Peggy whispers a tear falls down her face as she cups Steve’s face and looks deeply into his eyes.

“You’re not my Steve, are you?” She asked but she already knows this she can feel it in her heart. Steve touches her hands holding them for a moment. The soft pause between them.

“How did you know?” Steve asked.

“I can tell by your eyes. You look tired and worn, I can tell you’ve been through a lot,” Peggy rested her forehead on Steve’s forehead.

“Are you happy Pegs?” Steve asked in a shaky breath. Peggy smiled softly.

“I’m the happiest I’ve ever been,” Peggy said with a gentle smile.

“Good,” Steve said.

“What’s the real reason you came back?

“I just wanted to finally get that dance from my best girl,” Steve said flashing a charming smile as Peggy rolled her eyes and began to hum softly. Steve pulls Peggy in close as they dance slowly together.

“Hey, promise me when you go back you will find something or someone who makes you feel alive and wanted. I know it must be scary being out on your own but try and find your own home in your new world,” Peggy said with hopefulness in her eyes, as they broke apart. They leave the empty closet and Steve kisses her cheek and wishes her goodbye before saying one last thing.

“You don’t happen to still have my shield by chance?” Steve said with a cheeky smile as Peggy rolls her eyes again.

The next scene would Steve returning to his friends embracing them in a group hug with happy tears running down his face.

“You guys are my Family. And I’m sorry it took me a long time to realize this. That’s why I’m hanging up my shield and will be a full-time counselor for everyone coming back from the snap,” Steve said as Sam and Bucky look in awe.

“Who will be cap then?” Sam ask scrunching his brow. As Steve hands him the shield the two embraces while tears of happiness stream down both their faces.

“So, now what punk?” Bucky interrupts, Steve gives a grin.
“Well, I’ve always wanted to see the Grand Canyon,” Steve said.

Then the scene cuts to the highway three motorcycles are going down it when they pull up to the Grand Canyon. You see the three strangers take off their helmets and its Sam, Bucky, and Steve. They walk up to look over at the view of the Canyon as the camera zooms out.

“I can tell by your eyes. You look tired and worn, I can tell you’ve been through a lot,” Peggy rested her forehead on Steve’s forehead.

“Are you happy Pegs?” Steve asked in a shaky breath. Peggy smiled softly.

“I’m the happiest I’ve ever been,” Peggy said with a gentle smile.

“Good,” Steve said.

“What’s the real reason you came back?

“I just wanted to finally get that dance from my best girl,” Steve said flashing a charming smile as Peggy rolled her eyes and began to hum softly. Steve pulls Peggy in close as they dance slowly together.

“Hey, promise me when you go back you will find something or someone who makes you feel alive and wanted. I know it must be scary being out on your own but try and find your own home in your new world,” Peggy said with hopefulness in her eyes, as they broke apart. They leave the empty closet and Steve kisses her cheek and wishes her goodbye before saying one last thing.

“You don’t happen to still have my shield by chance?” Steve said with a cheeky smile as Peggy rolls her eyes again.

The next scene would Steve returning to his friends embracing them in a group hug with happy tears running down his face.

“You guys are my Family. And I’m sorry it took me a long time to realize this. That’s why I’m hanging up my shield and will be a full-time counselor for everyone coming back from the snap,” Steve said as Sam and Bucky look in awe.

“Who will be cap then?” Sam ask scrunching his brow. As Steve hands him the shield the two embraces while tears of happiness stream down both their faces.

“So, now what punk?” Bucky interrupts, Steve gives a grin.
“Well, I’ve always wanted to see the Grand Canyon,” Steve said.

Then the scene cuts to the highway three motorcycles are going down it when they pull up to the Grand Canyon. You see the three strangers take off their helmets and its Sam, Bucky, and Steve. They walk up to look over at the view of the Canyon as the camera zooms out.

trail.content_raw:
Hello, So for my film appreciation class we were allowed to rewrite an ending to a movie so I picked endgame but heads up this is straight from the paper so wording might be off

I would change the ending by showing Steve Rogers going to drop off the final piece of the device in the 70s were his former lover Peggy Carter was and showing him take a moment to look in her office as her husband and kids walk in on him. The scene would show Steve and Peggy’s husband having a brief conversation and Steve would say something along the lines of “I’m a custodian and I should go clean out the other rooms” as he would exit the room.

The viewers would see how sad and defeated he would be until he bumps into his old flame. He shields his face from her and deepens his voice, but Peggy recognizes him in an instance.

“Steve?” She would say alarmed and confused as he draggers her to an empty coat closet. Peggy would turn on the light illuminating the dark closet and then touch Steve face as tears well in both her eyes and his eyes.

“I thought…you were dead?” Peggy whispers a tear falls down her face as she cups Steve’s face and looks deeply into his eyes.

“You’re not my Steve, are you?” She asked but she already knows this she can feel it in her heart. Steve touches her hands holding them for a moment. The soft pause between them.

“How did you know?” Steve asked.

“I can tell by your eyes. You look tired and worn, I can tell you’ve been through a lot,” Peggy rested her forehead on Steve’s forehead.

“Are you happy Pegs?” Steve asked in a shaky breath. Peggy smiled softly.

“I’m the happiest I’ve ever been,” Peggy said with a gentle smile.

“Good,” Steve said.

“What’s the real reason you came back?

“I just wanted to finally get that dance from my best girl,” Steve said flashing a charming smile as Peggy rolled her eyes and began to hum softly. Steve pulls Peggy in close as they dance slowly together.

“Hey, promise me when you go back you will find something or someone who makes you feel alive and wanted. I know it must be scary being out on your own but try and find your own home in your new world,” Peggy said with hopefulness in her eyes, as they broke apart. They leave the empty closet and Steve kisses her cheek and wishes her goodbye before saying one last thing.

“You don’t happen to still have my shield by chance?” Steve said with a cheeky smile as Peggy rolls her eyes again.

The next scene would Steve returning to his friends embracing them in a group hug with happy tears running down his face.

“You guys are my Family. And I’m sorry it took me a long time to realize this. That’s why I’m hanging up my shield and will be a full-time counselor for everyone coming back from the snap,” Steve said as Sam and Bucky look in awe.

“Who will be cap then?” Sam ask scrunching his brow. As Steve hands him the shield the two embraces while tears of happiness stream down both their faces.

“So, now what punk?” Bucky interrupts, Steve gives a grin.
“Well, I’ve always wanted to see the Grand Canyon,” Steve said.

Then the scene cuts to the highway three motorcycles are going down it when they pull up to the Grand Canyon. You see the three strangers take off their helmets and its Sam, Bucky, and Steve. They walk up to look over at the view of the Canyon as the camera zooms out.
